  <script>
    (function () {
      const generateUUID = () =>
        "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-4xxx-yxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx".replace(/[xy]/g, function (c) {
          const r = (Math.random() * 16) | 0;
          const v = c === "x" ? r : (r & 0x3) | 0x8;
          return v.toString(16);
        });
  
      let isLocalStorageAvailable = false;
      const isAvailable = () => {
        if (isLocalStorageAvailable) {
          return true;
        }
  
        try {
          const x = "__storage_test__";
          window.localStorage.setItem(x, x);
          window.localStorage.removeItem(x);
          isLocalStorageAvailable = true;
          return true;
        } catch (e) {
          return false;
        }
      };
  
      const unsafeSetItem = (key, value) => {
        window.localStorage.setItem(key, JSON.stringify(value));
      };
  
      const unsafeGetItem = (key) => {
        return JSON.parse(window.localStorage.getItem(key) || "null");
      };
  
      const setSafeItem = (key, value) => {
        if (isAvailable()) {
          unsafeSetItem(key, value);
        }
      };
  
      const getSafeItem = (key, defaultValue) => {
        return isAvailable() ? unsafeGetItem(key) : defaultValue;
      };
  
      const ANA_UID_KEY = "ana_uid";
      let currentUid = getSafeItem(ANA_UID_KEY, "");
      if (!currentUid) {
        currentUid = generateUUID();
        setSafeItem(ANA_UID_KEY, currentUid);
      }
      window.getAnaUid = () => currentUid;
    })();
  </script>

  <script>
  function initialize_wunderkind(d) {
    window.addEventListener('load', function() {
      var e = d.createElement('script');
      e.src = d.location.protocol + '//tag.wknd.ai/5453/i.js';
      e.async = true;
      d.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(e);
    });
  }

  function determine_wunderkind_eligibility() {
    if (window.location.search.includes('enable_wunderkind')) {
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
      return;
    }

    let wunderkind_segment = 0;
    try { wunderkind_segment = localStorage.getItem('genius_wunderkind_segment'); } catch (e) {}

    if (typeof(wunderkind_segment) === 'string') {
      wunderkind_segment = Number(wunderkind_segment);
    } else {
      wunderkind_segment = Math.random();
      try { localStorage.setItem('genius_wunderkind_segment', wunderkind_segment); } catch (e) {}
    }

    if ((wunderkind_segment * 100) < 100.0) {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'wunderkind';
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
    } else {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'control';
    }
  }

  determine_wunderkind_eligibility();
</script>

    document.addEventListener('ANAReady', () => {
      anaWebInstance = new window.ANAWeb({
        lightMode: true,
        syncCookies: false,
        anaUid: window.getAnaUid(),
        premiumUser: false,
      });
    });

      });

class="About__Container-ut4i9m-1 eSiFpi"><h1 font-size="xxLargeHeadline" class="About__Title-ut4i9m-2 kcXwIY">About</h1><div class="SongDescription__Container-sc-615rvk-0 hYPlhL"><div class="Attribution__Container-sc-1nmry9o-0 dhIhSa"><div class="Attribution__Header-sc-1nmry9o-1 iPNsXE"><span>Genius Annotation</span><button text-decoration="underline" type="button" class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 ixMmYX">18 contributors</button></div></div><div class="ExpandableContent__Container-sc-1165iv-0 ikywhQ"><div class="ExpandableContent__Content-sc-1165iv-4 huhsMa"><div class="SongDescription__Content-sc-615rvk-2 kRzyD"><div class="RichText__Container-oz284w-0 dIOFGt"><p>Widely considered to be one of the <a href="http://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/the-500-greatest-songs-of-all-time-20110407/queen-bohemian-rhapsody-20110526" rel="noopener nofollow">greatest songs of all time</a>, â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ was the first single released from Queenâ€™s fourth studio album, <em><a href="https://genius.com/albums/Queen/A-night-at-the-opera" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/albums/35169">A Night at the Opera</a></em>. It became an international success, reaching #1 in seven countries and peaking at #9 in the United States. Seventeen years after its initial release, â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ re-entered the pop charts in the US, peaking at #2 after being featured in the 1992 hit movie <em><a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0105793/" rel="noopener nofollow">Wayneâ€™s World</a></em>. In 2002, the song was listed at #1 in <a href="http://www.queenarchives.com/index.php?title=Brian_May_-_08-XX-2002_-_Burns_Guitar_-_Canadian_Musician" rel="noopener nofollow">a Guinness World Records poll</a> as Britainâ€™s favourite single of all timeâ€”ranking higher than four <a href="https://genius.com/artists/The-beatles" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/artists/586">Beatles</a> tracks and <a href="https://genius.com/John-lennon-imagine-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/63416">â€œImagineâ€</a> by <a href="https://genius.com/artists/John-lennon" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/artists/16450">John Lennon</a>.</p>

<p>Complex and operatic both musically and lyrically, â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ (like <a href="https://genius.com/artists/Led-zeppelin" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/artists/562">Led Zeppelin</a>â€™s <a href="https://genius.com/Led-zeppelin-stairway-to-heaven-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/1061">â€œStairway to Heavenâ€</a> and <a href="https://genius.com/artists/The-eagles" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/artists/561">The Eagles</a>â€˜ <a href="https://genius.com/The-eagles-hotel-california-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/1060">â€œHotel Californiaâ€</a>) has attracted endless fan theories and commentary. The surviving band members have <a href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/3593532.stm" rel="noopener nofollow">claimed</a> that the narrative is based on the <a href="https://genius.com/albums/Johann-wolfgang-von-goethe/Faust-english" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/albums/50019">Faust legend</a>; critics have found possible sources in opera and Freddie Mercuryâ€™s personal biography; but like any good piece of art, itâ€™s open to interpretation.</p>

<p>The word <a href="https://www.britannica.com/topic/bohemian-artistic-subculture" rel="noopener nofollow">â€œBohemianâ€</a> seems to refer to a group of artists and musicians from the 19th century, known for defying convention and living with disregard for standards; as opposed to the region of <a href="https://www.britannica.com/place/Bohemia" rel="noopener nofollow">Bohemia</a> in the Czech Republic. Meanwhile the term <a href="https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/rhapsody" rel="noopener nofollow">â€œrhapsodyâ€</a> (derived from the Greek: á¿¥Î±Ïˆá¿³Î´ÏŒÏ‚ or rhapsÅidos for a reciter of epic poetry, or a rhapsodist) is a piece of classical music with distinct sections that are played as one movement. Rhapsodies often feature dense themes or narratives.</p>

<p>As of December 2018, â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ is the <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2018/12/11/entertainment/queen-bohemian-rhapsody-streams/index.html" rel="noopener nofollow">most streamed song</a> of the 20th century.</p>

<p>â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ has got a very diverse song structure. It includes:<br>
â€¢ <strong>Intro</strong> (0:00-0:49)<br>
â€¢ <strong>Ballad section</strong> (0:49-2:37)<br>

</ul></div></div></div><div class="QuestionAnswerActions__Container-sc-6ne2ji-0 dTXIVU"></div></div><div class="QuestionTemplate__Container-sc-1is5n1p-1 cgTISK"><div class="QuestionTemplate__Title-sc-1is5n1p-4 kXMkSg"><span>Where does &quot;Bohemian&quot; come from and what does it mean?</span><button class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 hVAZmF QuestionTemplate__ExpandButton-sc-1is5n1p-5 kukBgX" type="button"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M0 10h24v4h-24z"></path></svg></button></div><div class="Answer__Container-sc-2neq6u-0 iHvEbL"><div class="Attribution__Container-sc-1nmry9o-0 dhIhSa"><div class="Attribution__Header-sc-1nmry9o-1 iPNsXE"><span><div class="Answer__AttributionLabel-sc-2neq6u-3 doQBGH">Genius Answer</div></span><button text-decoration="underline" type="button" class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 ixMmYX">2 contributors</button></div></div><div class="Answer__Body-sc-2neq6u-1 fzIWba"><div class="RichText__Container-oz284w-0 dIOFGt"><p>A â€œbohemianâ€ is an unconventional artistic free spirit who lacks anything tying them down. It can also refer to the Kingdom of Bohemia, now part of Czechia. It became associated with that sort of lifestyle because <a href="http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=bohemian" rel="noopener nofollow">the French thought that was where travelling Romani communities came from.</a></p></div></div></div><div class="QuestionAnswerActions__Container-sc-6ne2ji-0 dTXIVU"></div></div><div class="QuestionTemplate__Container-sc-1is5n1p-1 cgTISK"><div class="QuestionTemplate__Title-sc-1is5n1p-4 kXMkSg"><span>Was he gay?</span><button class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 hVAZmF QuestionTemplate__ExpandButton-sc-1is5n1p-5 kukBgX" type="button"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M0 10h24v4h-24z"></path></svg></button></div><div class="Answer__Container-sc-2neq6u-0 iHvEbL"><div class="Attribution__Container-sc-1nmry9o-0 dhIhSa"><div class="Attribution__Header-sc-1nmry9o-1 iPNsXE"><span><div class="Answer__AttributionLabel-sc-2neq6u-3 doQBGH">Genius Answer</div></span><button text-decoration="underline" type="button" class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 ixMmYX">3 contributors</button></div></div><div class="Answer__Body-sc-2neq6u-1 fzIWba"><div class="RichText__Container-oz284w-0 dIOFGt"><p>â€œObjection, your Honor: context!â€ Re-phrase:</p>

<p>In late 1975, when Bo Rapâ€™s thunderbolts and lightning cast Queen as rock-gods, was Mercury struck as very, very <strong>openly</strong> gay?</p>

<p>To â€œbe gayâ€, or â€œnot to be gayâ€, in mid-1970â€™s England, was that a question of psychiatric, legal, and/or religious ramifications?  Mamma mia; â€œSpare him his life fromâ€ such monstrosities", right?</p>

<p>Bo-Rap is a thrill ride shape-shifter, from tragic tear-jerk-trigger-pulling proportions to the comedically scary mock-opera trial parts.  It took â€œWayneâ€™s Worldâ€ to push on the gas of the thrill ride back up the U.S. charts to not-quite-#1.  Before the snooty over-analysis to follow, letâ€™s get one thing straight: this song has plenty of Bohemian comedy, so line up your opera spectacles (is â€œoperaâ€ gay?).   And letâ€™s not forget the B-side: Rogerâ€™s â€œ<a href="https://genius.com/Queen-im-in-love-with-my-car-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/308921">Iâ€™m in Love With My Car</a>â€.  Was he, then, motorosexual?  Metrosexual?  Itâ€™s all dripping in the metaphorical.  Words, words, words, must be carefully chosen: ask <a href="https://genius.com/artists/Oscar-wilde" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/artists/24811">Oscar Wilde</a> or anyone accused of being heretical by the Papacy (scarier than reigning Queens, like certain â€¦ nevermind).</p>

<p>Was Galileo imprisoned for his heliocentrism?  Galileo Galilei was a <a href="https://genius.com/albums/Queen/Sheer-heart-attack/" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/albums/17350"><em>Sheer Heretic</em></a>, no? And if Dr. Brian May played the role of the 17th Century Astronomer, then who is Figaro, and were THEY straight?  Was the earth flat?  â€œObjection, your Honor!â€</p>

<p>Sustained; irreverent.  Scaramouche, re-direct the â€œgay connotationsâ€ rotation annotation to the 20th to 21st century.  Proceed:</p>

<p>Many folks interpret Bo Rapâ€™s lyrics as Mercuryâ€™s metaphoric struggle with his sexuality; <a href="https://genius.com/artists/Brian-may" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/artists/16631">Brian May</a> and <a href="https://genius.com/artists/Roger-taylor" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/artists/359481">Roger Taylor</a> have hinted at the viability of this â€œrapâ€ regarding Freddieâ€™s Bohemia.</p>

<p>Mercury let these lyrics â€œbeâ€ open to interpretation.  The song was a seedling as â€œThe Cowboy Songâ€.   That theme bit the dust ahead of time, but apparently left a smoking gun, anyway the wind blew pipes into Queenâ€™s three singing members in mock-opera splendor, the antithesis of a â€œmuteâ€ court.  Or was it an operatic jury from Hell passing judgment on the â€œloveâ€ that dare not speak its name?</p>

<p>Freddie did say the song was about â€œrelationshipsâ€; everyone can relate to that, regardless of â€œsexual preferencesâ€.</p>

<p>Sheila Whiteley co-authored a 2006 â€œbookâ€ of 19 essays about sexuality in popular music, â€œQueering the Popular Pitchâ€ (Eds. Sheila Whiteley and Jennifer Rycenga, published by Routledge).  <a href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/0415978041/ref=rdr_ext_tmbwithin/" rel="noopener nofollow"><em>Whiteleyâ€™s essay â€œPopular Music and the Dynamics of Desireâ€ on page 252 provides an informative summary, albeit with a lyrical stretch</em></a>,</p>

<blockquote><p>The heightened sense of urgency seems to resonate with Mercuryâ€™s inner turmoil, leaving the security of Mary Austin (who â€¦remained<br>
a close friend throughout his life) coming to terms with gay life (â€œEasy come, easy goâ€), and living with a man (â€œSo you think you can stone me and spit in my eyeâ€). Mary was, however, more perceptive than the song implies. At the time, Freddie had asked her if she thought he was bisexual. Her replyâ€”â€œI donâ€™t think youâ€™re bisexual. I think youâ€™re gayâ€ provides an insight into their relationship and her continuing support.</p></blockquote>

<p>When Queenâ€™s gravitational pull grounded their megastardom around the globe, Freddie was not openly gay, i.e., he was not â€œout-of-the-closetâ€ in a public way.  An openly gay rock star, especially in the United States, would have been the kiss-of-death if the fate of New York Cityâ€™s glam-rock overtly gay artist <a href="https://genius.com/search?q=Jobriath" rel="noopener">Jobriath</a> gives any clue.</p>

<p>Mary Austin was Freddieâ€™s dearest friend and family-member, by default and design.  His death is literally a testament to this.  <a href="https://www.thevintagenews.com/2017/07/18/mary-austin-the-woman-who-inspired-freddie-mercury-as-a-muse-and-stood-by-him-at-the-end/" rel="noopener nofollow"><em>The Vintage News notes</em></a>:</p>

<blockquote><p>Freddie Mercuryâ€™s will dictated that Mary was left with the better part of his wealth, more than $10 million, as well as his large mansion. His mother reportedly approved his decision, stating that Mary was like a family to her.</p></blockquote>

<p>Queenâ€™s monetary health (especially Freddieâ€™s) began with the success of Bo-Rap and their fourth album, â€œA Night at the Operaâ€.   Such artistic and commercial acclaim made all of Queenâ€™s men quite merry and GAY, and not merely because of the ensuing fame and pay, nor from relief at having severed the strings from their prior managers' greed, who allegedly swindled the band, so badly it spawned Mercuryâ€™s wrath on â€œA Night at the Operaâ€â€™s opening track, â€œ<a href="https://genius.com/Queen-death-on-two-legs-dedicated-to-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/159920">Death on Two Legs (Dedicated toâ€¦)</a>â€.</p>

<p>So was Freddie Mercury â€œgayâ€?  Or was he â€œbi-sexualâ€?  Is â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ his obvious â€œcoming outâ€ song?  Did his â€œpersonal inclinationsâ€ have a creative impact on Queenâ€™s music and performances for better or for worse?  â€œObjection your honor!â€ Sustained.  Queen still rules; Freddie sang his heart out for his fans, as much as he physically could, until the day he died.  In the age of Freddie A.D., the records have been set straight: Queenâ€™s crown as the peopleâ€™s band is legendary, transcending race, creed, identity, and the crazy little thing dubbed as a â€œrhapsodyâ€? Labels.  EMI (and Elektra?) didnâ€™t approve of its release.  But thatâ€™s a different story, and Freddieâ€™s sexual â€œlabelâ€ was a private, family matter to him, released or hidden in a metaphorical artistic sense?</p></div></div></div><div Queenâ€™s fourth studio album, A Night at the Opera. It became an international success, reaching #1 in seven countries and peaking at #9 in the United States. Seventeen years after its initial release, â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ re-entered the pop charts in the US, peaking at #2 after being featured in the 1992 hit movie Wayneâ€™s World. In 2002, the song was listed at #1 in a Guinness World Records poll as Britainâ€™s favourite single of all timeâ€”ranking higher than four Beatles tracks and â€œImagineâ€ by John Lennon.\\n\\nComplex and operatic both musically and lyrically, â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ (like Led Zeppelinâ€™s â€œStairway to Heavenâ€ and The Eaglesâ€˜ â€œHotel Californiaâ€) has attracted endless fan theories and commentary. The surviving band members have claimed that the narrative is based on the Faust legend; critics have found possible sources in opera and Freddie Mercuryâ€™s personal biography; but like any good piece of art, itâ€™s open to interpretation.\\n\\nThe word â€œBohemianâ€ seems to refer to a group of artists and musicians from the 19th century, known for defying convention and living with disregard for standards; as opposed to the region of Bohemia in the Czech Republic. Meanwhile the term â€œrhapsodyâ€ (derived from the Greek: á¿¥Î±Ïˆá¿³Î´ÏŒÏ‚ or rhapsÅidos for a reciter of epic poetry, or a rhapsodist) is a piece of classical music with distinct sections that are played as one movement. Rhapsodies often feature dense themes or narratives.\\n\\nAs of December 2018, â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ is the most streamed song of the 20th century.\\n\\nâ€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ has got a very diverse song structure. It includes:\\nâ€¢ Intro (0:00-0:49)\\nâ€¢ Ballad section (0:49-2:37)\\nâ€¢ Brian Mayâ€˜s guitar solo (2:37-3:05)\\nâ€¢ Operatic verse (3:05-4:07)\\nâ€¢ Hard-rock verse (4:07-4:54)\\nâ€¢ Coda (4:54-5:55)\",\"description\":{\"markdown\":\"Widely considered to be one of the [greatest songs of all time](http://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/the-500-greatest-songs-of-all-time-20110407/queen-bohemian-rhapsody-20110526), \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" was the first single released from Queen\'s fourth studio album, *[A Night at the Opera](http://genius.com/albums/Queen/A-night-at-the-opera)*. It became an international success, reaching #1 in seven countries and peaking at #9 in the United States. Seventeen years after its initial release, \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" re-entered the pop charts in the US, peaking at #2 after being featured in the 1992 hit movie *[Wayne\'s World](http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0105793/)*. In 2002, the song was listed at #1 in [a Guinness World Records poll](http://www.queenarchives.com/index.php?title=Brian_May_-_08-XX-2002_-_Burns_Guitar_-_Canadian_Musician) as Britain\'s favourite single of all time---ranking higher than four [Beatles](https://genius.com/artists/The-beatles) tracks and [\\\"Imagine\\\"](https://genius.com/John-lennon-imagine-lyrics) by [John Lennon](https://genius.com/artists/John-lennon). \\n\\nComplex and operatic both musically and lyrically, \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" (like [Led Zeppelin](/artists/Led-zeppelin)\'s [\\\"Stairway to Heaven\\\"](/Led-zeppelin-stairway-to-heaven-lyrics) and [The Eagles](/artists/The-eagles)\' [\\\"Hotel California\\\"](/The-eagles-hotel-california-lyrics)) has attracted endless fan theories and commentary. The surviving band members have [claimed](http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/3593532.stm) that the narrative is based on the [Faust legend](http://genius.com/albums/Johann-wolfgang-von-goethe/Faust-english); critics have found possible sources in opera and Freddie Mercury\'s personal biography; but like any good piece of art, it\'s open to interpretation.\\n\\nThe word [\\\"Bohemian\\\"](https://www.britannica.com/topic/bohemian-artistic-subculture) seems to refer to a group of artists and musicians from the 19th century, known for defying convention and living with disregard for standards; as opposed to the region of [Bohemia](https://www.britannica.com/place/Bohemia) in the Czech Republic. Meanwhile the term [\\\"rhapsody\\\"](https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/rhapsody) (derived from the Greek: á¿¥Î±Ïˆá¿³Î´ÏŒÏ‚ or rhapsÅidos for a reciter of epic poetry, or a rhapsodist) is a piece of classical music with distinct sections that are played as one movement. Rhapsodies often feature dense themes or narratives.\\n\\nAs of December 2018, \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" is the [most streamed song](https://www.cnn.com/2018/12/11/entertainment/queen-bohemian-rhapsody-streams/index.html) of the 20th century.\\n\\n\\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" has got a very diverse song structure. â€”@Genius\",\"state\":\"accepted\",\"source\":null,\"shareUrl\":\"https://genius.com/3490803\",\"referentId\":3490803,\"pyongsCount\":4,\"proposedEditCount\":1,\"pinned\":false,\"needsExegesis\":false,\"id\":3490803,\"hasVoters\":true,\"embedContent\":\"<blockquote class=\'rg_standalone_container\' data-src=\'//genius.com/annotations/3490803/standalone_embed\'><a href=\'https://genius.com/3490803/Queen-bohemian-rhapsody/Bohemian-rhapsody\'>Bohemian considered to be one of the [greatest songs of all time](http://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/the-500-greatest-songs-of-all-time-20110407/queen-bohemian-rhapsody-20110526), \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" was the first single released from Queen\'s fourth studio album, *[A Night at the Opera](http://genius.com/albums/Queen/A-night-at-the-opera)*. It became an international success, reaching #1 in seven countries and peaking at #9 in the United States. Seventeen years after its initial release, \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" re-entered the pop charts in the US, peaking at #2 after being featured in the 1992 hit movie *[Wayne\'s World](http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0105793/)*. In 2002, the song was listed at #1 in [a Guinness World Records poll](http://www.queenarchives.com/index.php?title=Brian_May_-_08-XX-2002_-_Burns_Guitar_-_Canadian_Musician) as Britain\'s favourite single of all time---ranking higher than four [Beatles](https://genius.com/artists/The-beatles) tracks and [\\\"Imagine\\\"](https://genius.com/John-lennon-imagine-lyrics) by [John Lennon](https://genius.com/artists/John-lennon). \\n\\nComplex and operatic both musically and lyrically, \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" (like [Led Zeppelin](/artists/Led-zeppelin)\'s [\\\"Stairway to Heaven\\\"](/Led-zeppelin-stairway-to-heaven-lyrics) and [The Eagles](/artists/The-eagles)\' [\\\"Hotel California\\\"](/The-eagles-hotel-california-lyrics)) has attracted endless fan theories and commentary. The surviving band members have [claimed](http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/3593532.stm) that the narrative is based on the [Faust legend](http://genius.com/albums/Johann-wolfgang-von-goethe/Faust-english); critics have found possible sources in opera and Freddie Mercury\'s personal biography; but like any good piece of art, it\'s open to interpretation.\\n\\nThe word [\\\"Bohemian\\\"](https://www.britannica.com/topic/bohemian-artistic-subculture) seems to refer to a group of artists and musicians from the 19th century, known for defying convention and living with disregard for standards; as opposed to the region of [Bohemia](https://www.britannica.com/place/Bohemia) in the Czech Republic. Meanwhile the term [\\\"rhapsody\\\"](https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/rhapsody) (derived from the Greek: á¿¥Î±Ïˆá¿³Î´ÏŒÏ‚ or rhapsÅidos for a reciter of epic poetry, or a rhapsodist) is a piece of classical music with distinct sections that are played as one movement. Rhapsodies often feature dense themes or narratives.\\n\\nAs of December 2018, \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" is the [most streamed song](https://www.cnn.com/2018/12/11/entertainment/queen-bohemian-rhapsody-streams/index.html) of the 20th century.\\n\\n\\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" has got a very diverse song structure. most sensible literal reading of the song is that the narrator confesses to a murder, is put on trial, and either escapes or gets executed. Figurative readings---like interpretations that it is an allegory for Freddie\'s struggles with his sexuality---are also possible, but harder to support.\",\"body\":{\"markdown\":\"The most sensible literal reading of the song is that the narrator confesses to a murder, is put on trial, and either escapes or gets executed. Figurative readings---like interpretations that it is an allegory for Freddie\'s struggles with his sexuality---are also possible, but harder to support.\",\"html\":\"<p>The most sensible literal reading of the song is that the narrator confesses to a murder, is put on trial, and either escapes or gets executed. Figurative readingsâ€”like interpretations that it is an allegory for Freddieâ€™s struggles with his sexualityâ€”are also possible, but harder to support.<\/p>\"},\"type\":\"answer\"},\"24955\":{\"authors\":[{\"user\":265732,\"pinnedRole\":null,\"attribution\":1,\"type\":\"user_attribution\"}],\"answerSource\":null,\"currentUserMetadata\":{\"interactions\":{\"vote\":null},\"excludedPermissions\":[\"vote\",\"edit\",\"destroy\"],\"permissions\":[]},\"votesTotal\":20,\"id\":24955,\"hasVoters\":true,\"editorialState\":\"normal\",\"createdAt\":1488200622,\"bodyForEdit\":\"There is nothing connecting any of the characters in the song to Freddie\'s bandmates. Indeed, he started writing the song before he met them. Some argue that \\\"Mamma\\\" is Mary Austin, Freddie\'s long-term partner. A year after the release of \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\", Freddie confessed to her that he was bisexual and their relationship ended.\",\"body\":{\"markdown\":\"There is nothing connecting any of the characters in the song to Freddie\'s bandmates. Indeed, he started writing the song before he met them. Some argue that â€œMammaâ€ is Mary Austin, Freddieâ€™s long-term partner. A year after the release of â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€, Freddie confessed to her that he was bisexual and their relationship ended.<\/p>\"},\"type\":\"answer\"},\"25223\":{\"authors\":[{\"user\":265732,\"pinnedRole\":null,\"attribution\":1,\"type\":\"user_attribution\"}],\"answerSource\":null,\"currentUserMetadata\":{\"interactions\":{\"vote\":null},\"excludedPermissions\":[\"vote\",\"edit\",\"destroy\"],\"permissions\":[]},\"votesTotal\":118,\"id\":25223,\"hasVoters\":true,\"editorialState\":\"normal\",\"createdAt\":1488383154,\"bodyForEdit\":\"A \\\"bohemian\\\" is an unconventional artistic free spirit who lacks anything tying them down. It can also refer to the Kingdom of Bohemia, now part of Czechia. It became associated with that sort of lifestyle because [the French thought that was where travelling Romani communities came from.](http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=bohemian)\",\"body\":{\"markdown\":\"A \\\"bohemian\\\" is an unconventional artistic free spirit who lacks anything tying them down. It can also refer to the Kingdom of Bohemia, now part of Czechia. It became associated with that sort of lifestyle because [the French thought that was where travelling Romani communities came from.](http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=bohemian)\",\"html\":\"<p>A â€œbohemianâ€ is an unconventional artistic free spirit who lacks anything tying them down. It can also refer to the Kingdom of Bohemia, now part of Czechia. It became associated with that sort of lifestyle because <a href=\\\"http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=bohemian\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">the French thought that was where travelling Romani communities came Translation<\/a><\/li>\\n<\/ul>\"},\"type\":\"answer\"},\"110739\":{\"authors\":[{\"user\":4365014,\"pinnedRole\":null,\"attribution\":0.998780487804878,\"type\":\"user_attribution\"},{\"user\":7447663,\"pinnedRole\":null,\"attribution\":0.0012195121951219512,\"type\":\"user_attribution\"}],\"answerSource\":null,\"currentUserMetadata\":{\"interactions\":{\"vote\":null},\"excludedPermissions\":[\"vote\",\"edit\",\"destroy\"],\"permissions\":[]},\"votesTotal\":67,\"id\":110739,\"hasVoters\":true,\"editorialState\":\"normal\",\"createdAt\":1525197790,\"bodyForEdit\":\"\\\"Objection, your Honor: context!\\\" Re-phrase:\\n\\nIn late 1975, when Bo Rap\'s thunderbolts and lightning cast Queen as rock-gods, was Mercury struck as very, very **openly** gay?  \\n\\nTo \\\"be gay\\\", or \\\"not to be gay\\\", in mid-1970\'s England, was that a question of psychiatric, legal, and/or religious ramifications?  Mamma mia; \\\"Spare him his life from\\\" such monstrosities\\\", right? \\n\\nBo-Rap is a thrill ride shape-shifter, from tragic tear-jerk-trigger-pulling proportions to the comedically scary mock-opera trial parts.  It took \\\"Wayne\'s World\\\" to push on the gas of the thrill ride back up the U.S. charts to not-quite-#1.  Before the snooty over-analysis to follow, let\'s get one thing straight: this song has plenty of Bohemian comedy, so line up your opera spectacles (is \\\"opera\\\" gay?).   And let\'s not forget the B-side: Roger\'s \\\"[I\'m in Love With My Car](/Queen-im-in-love-with-my-car-lyrics)\\\".  Was he, then, motorosexual?  Metrosexual?  It\'s all dripping in the metaphorical.  Words, words, words, must be carefully chosen: ask [Oscar Wilde](/artists/Oscar-wilde) or anyone accused of being heretical by the Papacy (scarier than reigning Queens, like certain ... nevermind).\\n\\nWas Galileo imprisoned for his heliocentrism?  Galileo Galilei was a [*Sheer Heretic*](https://genius.com/albums/Queen/Sheer-heart-attack/), no? And if Dr. Brian May played the role of the 17th Century Astronomer, then who is Figaro, and were THEY straight?  Was the earth flat?  \\\"Objection, your Honor!\\\" \\n\\nSustained; irreverent.  Scaramouche, re-direct the \\\"gay connotations\\\" rotation annotation to the 20th to 21st century.  Proceed:\\n\\nMany folks interpret Bo Rap\'s lyrics as Mercury\'s metaphoric struggle with his sexuality; [Brian May](/artists/Brian-may) and [Roger Taylor](/artists/Roger-taylor) have hinted at the viability of this \\\"rap\\\" regarding Freddie\'s Bohemia.\\n\\nMercury let these lyrics \\\"be\\\" open to interpretation.  The song was a seedling as \\\"The Cowboy Song\\\".   That theme bit the dust ahead of time, but apparently left a smoking gun, anyway the wind blew pipes into Queen\'s three singing members in mock-opera splendor, the antithesis of a \\\"mute\\\" court.  Or was it an operatic jury from Hell passing judgment on the \\\"love\\\" that dare not speak its name?  \\n\\nFreddie did say the song was about \\\"relationships\\\"; everyone can relate to that, regardless of \\\"sexual preferences\\\".  \\n\\nSheila Whiteley co-authored a 2006 \\\"book\\\" of 19 essays about sexuality in popular music, \\\"Queering the Popular Pitch\\\" (Eds. Sheila Whiteley and Jennifer Rycenga, published by Routledge).  [*Whiteley\'s essay \\\"Popular Music and the Dynamics of Desire\\\" on page 252 provides an informative summary, albeit with a lyrical stretch*](https://www.amazon.com/dp/0415978041/ref=rdr_ext_tmbwithin/),\\n>The heightened sense of urgency seems to resonate with Mercuryâ€™s inner turmoil, leaving the security of Mary Austin (who ...remained \\na close friend throughout his life) coming to terms with gay life (â€œEasy come, easy goâ€), and living with a man (â€œSo you think you can stone me and spit in my eyeâ€). Mary was, however, more perceptive than the song implies. At the time, Freddie had asked her if she thought he was bisexual. Her replyâ€”â€œI donâ€™t think youâ€™re bisexual. I think youâ€™re gayâ€ provides an insight into their relationship and her continuing support.\\n\\nWhen Queen\'s gravitational pull grounded their megastardom around the globe, Freddie was not openly gay, i.e., he was not \\\"out-of-the-closet\\\" in a public way.  An openly gay rock star, especially in the United States, would have been the kiss-of-death if the fate of New York City\'s glam-rock overtly gay artist [Jobriath](https://genius.com/search?q=Jobriath) gives any clue.  \\n\\nMary Austin was Freddie\'s dearest friend and family-member, by default and design.  His death is literally a testament to this.  [*The Vintage News notes*](https://www.thevintagenews.com/2017/07/18/mary-austin-the-woman-who-inspired-freddie-mercury-as-a-muse-and-stood-by-him-at-the-end/):\\n>Freddie Mercuryâ€™s will dictated that Mary was left with the better part of his wealth, more than \$10 million, as well as his large mansion. His mother reportedly approved his decision, stating that Mary was like a family to her.\\n\\nQueen\'s monetary health (especially Freddie\'s) began with the success of Bo-Rap and their fourth album, \\\"A Night at the Opera\\\".   Such artistic and commercial acclaim made all of Queen\'s men quite merry and GAY, and not merely because of the ensuing fame and pay, nor from relief at having severed the strings from their prior managers\' greed, who allegedly swindled the band, so badly it spawned Mercury\'s wrath on \\\"A Night at the Opera\\\"\'s opening track, \\\"[Death on Two Legs (Dedicated to...)](/Queen-death-on-two-legs-dedicated-to-lyrics)\\\".  \\n\\nSo was Freddie Mercury \\\"gay\\\"?  Or was he \\\"bi-sexual\\\"?  Is \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" his obvious \\\"coming out\\\" song?  Did his \\\"personal inclinations\\\" have a creative impact on Queen\'s music and performances for better or for worse?  \\\"Objection your honor!\\\" Sustained.  Queen still rules; Freddie sang his heart out for his fans, as much as he physically could, until the day he died.  In the age of Freddie A.D., the records have been set straight: Queen\'s crown as the people\'s band is legendary, transcending race, creed, identity, and the crazy little thing dubbed as a \\\"rhapsody\\\"? Labels.  EMI (and Elektra?) didn\'t approve of its release.  But that\'s a different story, and Freddie\'s sexual \\\"label\\\" was a private, family matter to him, released or hidden in a metaphorical artistic sense?\",\"body\":{\"markdown\":\"\\\"Objection, your Honor: context!\\\" Re-phrase:\\n\\nIn late 1975, when Bo Rap\'s thunderbolts and lightning cast Queen as rock-gods, was Mercury struck as very, very **openly** gay?  \\n\\nTo \\\"be gay\\\", or \\\"not to be gay\\\", in mid-1970\'s England, was that a question of psychiatric, legal, and/or religious ramifications? The video for the track was recorded on November 10, 1975. It took just four hours to film and another five to edit, at a total cost of Â£4,500. It was aired on Top Of The Pops for the first time on November 20 of that year. When other artists and record labels saw how effective a promotional video could be, they all climbed on the bandwagon---the music industry has never been the same since!\\n\\nAs for the visual effects, the [Music Video Wikia](http://musicvideo.wikia.com/wiki/Bohemian_Rhapsody) page for \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" describes them as such:\\n\\n> The video opens with a shot of the four band members in near darkness as they sing the a cappella part. The lights fade up, and the shots cross-fade into close-ups of Freddie. All of the special effects were achieved during the recording. The effect of the face zooming away was accomplished by pointing the camera at a monitor, giving visual feedback, a visual glare, analogous to audio feedback. The honeycomb effect was achieved by using a shaped lens.\",\"body\":{\"markdown\":\"According to [officialcharts.com](https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/queen-s-bohemian-rhapsody-voted-the-nation-s-favourite-number-1-single__2258/):\\n\\n>\'Bohemian Rhapsody\' is responsible for the modern music video. The video for the track was recorded on November 10, 1975. It took just four hours to film and another five to edit, at a total cost of Â£4,500. It was aired on Top Of The Pops for the first time on November 20 of that year. When other artists and record labels saw how effective a promotional video could be, they all climbed on the bandwagon---the music industry has never been the same since!\\n\\nAs for the visual effects, the [Music Video Wikia](http://musicvideo.wikia.com/wiki/Bohemian_Rhapsody) page for \\\"Bohemian Rhapsody\\\" describes them as such:\\n\\n> The video opens with a shot of the four band members in near darkness as they sing the a cappella part. The lights fade up, and the shots cross-fade into close-ups of Freddie. All of the special effects were achieved during the recording. The effect of the face zooming away was accomplished by pointing the camera at a monitor, giving visual feedback, a visual glare, analogous to audio feedback. The honeycomb effect was achieved by using a shaped lens.\",\"html\":\"<p>According to <a href=\\\"https://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/queen-s-bohemian-rhapsody-voted-the-nation-s-favourite-number-1-single__2258/\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">officialcharts.com<\/a>:<\/p>\\n\\n<blockquote><p>â€˜Bohemian Rhapsodyâ€™ is responsible for the modern music video. The video for the track was recorded on November 10, 1975. It took just four hours to film and another five to edit, at a total cost of Â£4,500. It was aired on Top Of The Pops for the first time on November 20 of that year. When other artists and record labels saw how effective a promotional video could be, they all climbed on the bandwagonâ€”the music industry has never been the same since!<\/p><\/blockquote>\\n\\n<p>As for the visual effects, the <a href=\\\"http://musicvideo.wikia.com/wiki/Bohemian_Rhapsody\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">Music Video Wikia<\/a> page for â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ describes them as such:<\/p>\\n\\n<blockquote><p>The video opens with a shot of the four band members in near darkness as they sing the a cappella part. The lights fade up, and the shots cross-fade into close-ups of Freddie. All of the special effects were achieved during the recording. The effect of the face zooming away was accomplished by pointing the camera at a monitor, giving visual feedback, a visual glare, analogous to audio feedback. The honeycomb effect was achieved by using a shaped lens.<\/p><\/blockquote>\"},\"type\":\"answer\"},\"162520\":{\"authors\":[{\"user\":3343130,\"pinnedRole\":null,\"attribution\":0.5652173913043478,\"type\":\"user_attribution\"},{\"user\":1603328,\"pinnedRole\":null,\"attribution\":0.43478260869565216,\"type\":\"user_attribution\"}],\"answerSource\":null,\"currentUserMetadata\":{\"interactions\":{\"vote\":null},\"excludedPermissions\":[\"vote\",\"edit\",\"destroy\"],\"permissions\":[]},\"votesTotal\":17,\"id\":162520,\"hasVoters\":true,\"editorialState\":\"normal\",\"createdAt\":1544737992,\"bodyForEdit\":\"Lead singer [Freddie Mercury](genius.com/artists/Freddie-mercury) died of bronchial pneumonia in November 1991, as a result of his ongoing battle with AIDS. Bassist [John Deacon](genius.com/artists/John-deacon) left the industry soon afterward. As of 2020, guitarist [Brian May](genius.com/artists/Brian-may) and drummer [Roger Taylor](genius.com/artists/Roger-taylor) still tour together as Queen, alongside [Adam Lambert](genius.com/artists/Adam-lambert).\",\"body\":{\"markdown\":\"Lead singer [Freddie Mercury](genius.com/artists/Freddie-mercury) died of bronchial pneumonia in November 1991, as a result of his ongoing battle with AIDS.
